intro: Descurainia titicacensis var. dasycarpa, commonly known as the Andean bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces distinctive, inflated seed pods that are often covered in a dense layer of hairs. This variety is adapted to cool, high-altitude environments and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
